column4: Im getting this error: "grep: /etc/resolv.conf: no such file or directory" when im trying to doing a networking restart, does someone have solution in mind?
Im getting this error: "grep: /etc/resolv.conf: no such file or directory" when im trying to do a "networking restart". Does someone have solution how to prevent this error to occur?
you could make an empty resolv.conf file
all it is is a list of the nameservers mainly.
and the last 2 dns servers are googles.. the 8.8.xxx
Should i restart the network or the computer after im done with the settings?
that file is supposed to auto-update when ever you restart the networking.
if you feel lucky.. reboot. :) or just restart networking
Let's hope tis work! hold your thumbs
that tells your system what dns to use.
use 8.8.8.8 and the 8.8.4.4 if you want. those are googles dns servers
